intro: Crotalaria incanescens, commonly known as the white crown flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with a white crown-like structure. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in areas with full sun. Crotalaria incanescens is also noted for its potential use in phytoremediation due to its ability to accumulate heavy metals.
